newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sita to sell some Belgian assets.
newsitem.headline: Sita to sell some Belgian assets.

text.p: Waste management company Sita, a unit of Lyonnaise des Eaux, said on Tuesday it would sell some waste treatment assets in Belgium to obtain clearance for the Lyonnaise merger with Compagnie de Suez.
In a statement Sita said it would sell its minority stake in Page and other activities yet to be defined.
In Brussels, European Commissioner Karel Van Miert said the merger would receive the green light. The Commission has run a routine probe into the proposed merger.

"In order to obtain the agreement of the Commission, Lyonnaise des Eaux and Compagnie de Suez have taken the commitment to reduce their stakes in some sectors of the waste management market in Belgium, following effective completion of the merger," the Sita statement said.
It said the board approved the sales at a meeting on Monday.
Lyonnaise controls 66 percent of Sita, which in turn owns 49 percent of Page. Page contributed 124 million francs to Sita's 1996 sales of 9.2 billion francs.
Sita said the sales would have no impact on its strategy or slow its development abroad.
